title: How to give a senior leader feedback (without getting fired)
dot: digraph FeedbackFramework{rankdir=TB;node[shape=rect, style=filled, fillcolor=lightblue, fontname="Arial"];edge[arrowhead=vee, color=black];Start[label="How to Give Feedback to Senior Leaders"]; Approach1[label="Self-Assessment"];Approach2[label="Framing the Feedback"];Approach3[label="Using Supporting Data"];Approach4[label="Adopting Diplomatic Language"];Sub1A[label="Ask: Can I improve the situation myself?"];Sub1B[label="Consider: Is giving feedback worth the risk?"];Sub1C[label="Evaluate: Am I part of the problem?"]; Sub2A[label="Use the 'Even More' Technique"];Sub2B[label="Share Your Own Experience"];Sub2C[label="Position Suggestions Non-Threateningly"];Sub3A[label="Provide Specific Examples"];Sub3B[label="Show Upside of Changes"];Sub3C[label="End with Actionable Suggestions"];Sub4A[label="Use Curiosity-Forward Language (e.g., 'I wonder if...')"];Sub4B[label="Be Concise and Positive"];Sub4C[label="Avoid Over-Explaining"]; Start->Approach1;Start->Approach2;Start->Approach3;Start->Approach4;Approach1->Sub1A;Approach1->Sub1B;Approach1->Sub1C;Approach2->Sub2A;Approach2->Sub2B;Approach2->Sub2C;Approach3->Sub3A;Approach3->Sub3B;Approach3->Sub3C;Approach4->Sub4A;Approach4->Sub4B;Approach4->Sub4C;Notes[label="Note: Feedback is an Inversion of Norms. Aim to Reduce Threat to Recipient.", shape=note, fillcolor=lightyellow];Sub2A->Notes[style=dotted];}

title: SQLite’s Use of Tcl (2017)
dot:
digraph SQLite_TCL_Relationship{node[shape=box, style=filled, fillcolor=lightblue, fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=12];title[label="SQLite and TCL Relationship", shape=ellipse, fillcolor=lightgray];intro[label="1. Introduction
SQLite is a TCL extension that has escaped into the wild.", shape=rect];about_sqlite[label="1.1 About SQLite
- Widely used SQL database engine
- Core component in cellphones, browsers, OS", shape=rect];sqlite_tcl_extension[label="1.2 SQLite is a TCL Extension, Not a TCL Application
- SQLite is used by TCL
- Written in ANSI C", shape=rect];dependency[label="2. How SQLite Depends on TCL
- SQLite began as a TCL extension
- Most applications using SQLite are not written in TCL", shape=rect];source_code[label="2.1 SQLite Source Code is Mostly TCL
- sqlite3.c and sqlite3.h are 100% ANSI-C
- Over 50% of source tree is TCL code", shape=rect];machine_generated[label="2.2 Machine Generated C Code
- Uses TCL scripts for building C code
- TCL automates amalgamation process", shape=rect];analyzer_utility[label="2.3 sqlite3_analyzer Utility
- Examines database usage
- Disguised as a C application, but is a TCL app", shape=rect];testing[label="2.4 TCL Used for Testing SQLite
- Extensive testing with TCL scripts
- Achieves high coverage and reliability", shape=rect];documentation[label="2.5 TCL Generated Documentation
- API and documentation generated by TCL scripts
- Ensures consistency with source code", shape=rect];dev_tools[label="2.6 Tcl/Tk Used During Development
- Custom editor built on Tk
- Fossil version control uses Tcl/Tk for diffs", shape=rect];summary[label="3. Summary
SQLite is essential in modern systems
TCL is crucial for SQLite's development and maintenance", shape=rect];title->intro;intro->about_sqlite;intro->sqlite_tcl_extension;intro->dependency;dependency->source_code;dependency->machine_generated;dependency->analyzer_utility;dependency->testing;dependency->documentation;dependency->dev_tools;dev_tools->summary;}
